uk.blankaspect.common.json

Class JsonObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.blankaspect.common.json.JsonValue
      • uk.blankaspect.common.json.JsonObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    uk.blankaspect.common.tree.ITreeNode<JsonValue>

    public class JsonObject
extends JsonValue
    This class implements a JSON object value. A JSON object may contain zero or more properties. A property is a name–value pair whose name is a string and whose value is a JSON value. The name of a property is separated from the value with a ':' (U+003A).

    An object begins with a '{' (U+007B) and ends with a '}' (U+007D). Within an object, adjacent properties are separated with a ',' (U+002C).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JsonObject.NoSuchPropertyException
      This class implements an unchecked exception that is thrown when an attempt is made to access a property of a JSON object by name and the JSON object does not contain a property with the specified name.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class uk.blankaspect.common.json.JsonValue

        JsonValue.Kind

      • getNull

        public JsonNull getNull(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the property of this JSON object with the specified name as a JSON null value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property whose value is required.
        Returns:
        the value of the property of this JSON object whose name is name, cast to a JsonNull.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the named property is not an instance of JsonNull.

      • getNull

        public JsonNull getNull(java.lang.String name,
                        boolean mustExist)
        Returns the property of this JSON object with the specified name as a JSON null value. If there is no such property, this method either returns null or throws a JsonObject.NoSuchPropertyException according to the value of its mustExist argument.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property whose value is required.
        mustExist - if true, a NoSuchPropertyException will be thrown if this object does not contain a property whose name is name; if false, null will be returned if this object does not contain the named property.
        Returns:
        the value of the property of this JSON object whose name is name, cast to a JsonNull, or null if mustExist is false and this object contains no such property.
        Throws:
        JsonObject.NoSuchPropertyException - if mustExist is true and this object does not contain a property whose name is name.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the named property is not an instance of JsonNull.

      • getProperties

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,JsonValue> getProperties()
        Returns an unmodifiable map of the properties of this JSON object. The iterator over the entries of the map (Map.entrySet()) returns the properties in the order in which they were added to this JSON object.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable map of the properties of this JSON object.

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,JsonValue> properties)
        Sets the properties of this JSON object to the specified pairs of names and JSON values.
        Parameters:
        properties - the pairs of names and JSON values to which the properties of this JSON object will be set.

      • addProperty

        public void addProperty(java.lang.String name,
                        JsonValue value)
        Adds a property with the specified name and value to this JSON object. If this object already contains a property with the specified name, the specified value will replace the value of the existing property without affecting the order of properties; otherwise, a new entry will be added to end of the map of properties.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property.
        value - the value of the property.

      • addProperties

        public void addProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,JsonValue> properties)
        Adds the specified pairs of names and JSON values to the properties of this JSON object. If this object already contains a property with a specified name, the corresponding specified value will replace the value of the existing property without affecting the order of properties; otherwise, a new entry will be added to end of the map of properties. Properties are added in the order in which they are returned by the iterator of the entries of the input map.
        Parameters:
        properties - the pairs of names and JSON values that will be added to the end of the properties of this JSON object.

      • addNull

        public JsonNull addNull(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new instance of a JSON null value, adds it to this JSON object as a property with the specified name and returns it. If this object already contains a property with the specified name, the new JSON null value will replace the value of the existing property without affecting the order of properties; otherwise, a new entry will be added to end of the map of properties.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the JSON-null property.
        Returns:
        the JSON null value that was created and added to this JSON object as a property whose name is name.

      • addBoolean

        public JsonBoolean addBoolean(java.lang.String name,
                              boolean value)
        Creates a new instance of a JSON Boolean with the specified value, adds it to this JSON object as a property with the specified name and returns it. If this object already contains a property with the specified name, the new JSON Boolean will replace the value of the existing property without affecting the order of properties; otherwise, a new entry will be added to end of the map of properties.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the JSON-Boolean property.
        value - the value of the JSON-Boolean property.
        Returns:
        the JSON Boolean that was created from value and added to this JSON object as a property whose name is name.

                            int value)
        Creates a new instance of a JSON number with the specified int value, adds it to this JSON object as a property with the specified name and returns it. If this object already contains a property with the specified name, the new JSON number will replace the value of the existing property without affecting the order of properties; otherwise, a new entry will be added to end of the map of properties.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the JSON-number property.
        value - the value of the JSON-number property.
        Returns:
        the JSON number that was created from value and added to this JSON object as a property whose name is name.

        public JsonArray addArray(java.lang.String name,
                          JsonValue... elements)
        Creates a new instance of a JSON array with the specified elements, adds it to this JSON object as a property with the specified name and returns it. If this object already contains a property with the specified name, the new JSON array will replace the value of the existing property without affecting the order of properties; otherwise, a new entry will be added to end of the map of properties.
        Parameters:

        elements - the elements of the JSON array that will be created and added to this JSON object as a property whose name is name.
        Returns:
        the JSON array that was created from elements and added to this JSON object as a property whose name is name.

        Parameters:
